content.question:
For parts of the free-response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate.

<math alttext="2 N O gas plus O 2 gas react to produce 2 N O 2 gas, where delta H naught equals negative 112 kilojoules per mole of reaction"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="3.0em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>112</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

Answer the following questions about the reaction represented above at <math alttext="298 Kelvin"><mstyle><mrow><mn>298</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Absolute Entropy at <math alttext="298 Kelvin in joules per Kelvin per mole"><mstyle><mrow><mn>298</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mo>(</mo><mtext>J</mtext><mo>/</mo><mo>(</mo><mtext>K</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>o</mtext><mtext>l</mtext><mo>)</mo><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="N O gas"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 211

<math alttext="O 2 gas"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 205

<math alttext="N O 2 gas"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 240

(a) Using the information in the table above, calculate the value of <math alttext="delta S naught"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the reaction.

frqParts.text:
For parts of the free-response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate.

<math alttext="2 N O gas plus O 2 gas react to produce 2 N O 2 gas, where delta H naught equals negative 112 kilojoules per mole of reaction"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="3.0em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>112</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

Answer the following questions about the reaction represented above at <math alttext="298 Kelvin"><mstyle><mrow><mn>298</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Absolute Entropy at <math alttext="298 Kelvin in joules per Kelvin per mole"><mstyle><mrow><mn>298</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mo>(</mo><mtext>J</mtext><mo>/</mo><mo>(</mo><mtext>K</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>o</mtext><mtext>l</mtext><mo>)</mo><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="N O gas"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 211

<math alttext="O 2 gas"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 205

<math alttext="N O 2 gas"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 240

(a) Using the information in the table above, calculate the value of <math alttext="delta S naught"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the reaction.

(b) Is the reaction thermodynamically favorable at <math alttext="298 Kelvin" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>298</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>? Justify your answer based on the calculation of the value and sign of <math alttext="delta G naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(c) Is the value of the equilibrium constant, <math alttext="K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, for the reaction greater than 1, or less than 1 ? Justify your answer.

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
